p: KAlH 4 has an acceptable total hydrogen content of 5.75 wt.% and a reversible hydrogen storage capacity of 4.3 wt.% (through reactions (34) and (35)). These values are comparable to NaAlH 4 and, additionally, KAlH 4 does not need a catalyst to undergo re-hydrogenation at a hydrogen pressure as low as 10 bar [ 161]. KAlH 4 can be produced by direct synthesis in organic solvent from KH, Al, and hydrogen [ 21], or in powder form under high pressure of hydrogen (>175 bar) and heating [ 162], or by mechanical milling, followed by hydrogen exposure [ 161], or by the reactive mechanical milling in hydrogen atmosphere [ 163, 164], or by the metathesis of NaAlH 4 or LiAlH 4 with KCl promoted by ball milling [ 165].
